abstract: Residents of Newport, Rhode Island, are trying to combat rapid aging of town's signature European beech trees; effort is particularly urgent because trees were largely planted at once, 120 years ago, as town became centerpiece of gilded-age opulence.
snippet: Signature trees planted more or less all at once about 120 years ago are aging all at once now.
lead_paragraph: Signature trees planted more or less all at once about 120 years ago are aging all at once now.

headline.main: Next for Newport Preservation: Gilded-Age Beeches
headline.print_headline: Next for Newport Preservation: Gilded-Age Beeches
headline.seo: Trouble for Gilded-Age Beech Trees in Newport, Rhode Island
